body:
The instructions on how to set up your development environment for contributing to docker/cli doesn't exist on the main docs site anymore.

Do we want to maintain such a setup guide on the docs site, or should it live directly in the contribution guide for specific repositories? e.g., cli, compose, and moby.

CC @thaJeztah

issue.title: 404 at /opensource/project/who-written-for/
issue.body:
I found a broken link : https://docs.docker.com/opensource/project/who-written-for/
I arrived on this page through: https://github.com/docker/cli/blob/e1152b2418833c2e39b7114c1ebb12d2278792a3/CONTRIBUTING.md

body: @thaJeztah Could I try to tackle this? and do you have any suggestions/recommendations? many thanks!

issue.title: Removed dead external link #937
issue.body:
- What I did    
Removed broken link in #937
- How I did it 
Removed first section of CONTRIBUTING.md
- How to verify it 
Check CONTRIBUTING.md
- Description for the changelog 
Removed broken link in contributing to Docker documentation. A picture of a cute animal (not mandatory but encouraged) Closes #937
Signed-off-by: Alexander Chneerov <achneerov@gmail.com>

issue.title: Removed broken link
issue.body:
- fixes https://github.com/docker/cli/issues/937


- What I did
 Removed broken link in #937
- How I did it
Removed first section of CONTRIBUTING.md
- How to verify it
 Check CONTRIBUTING.md
- Description for the changelog 
Removed section with broken link in contributing to Docker documentation.
A picture of a cute animal (not mandatory but encouraged)
